definitions.definition: The condition of being exposed, uncovered, or unprotected.
definitions.example: Limit your exposure to harsh chemicals.   Get as much exposure to a new language as you can.

definitions.definition: Lack of protection from weather or the elements.
The act of exposing something, such as a scandal.
That part which is facing or exposed to something, e.g. the sun, weather, sky, or a view.
definitions.example: They rented a cabin with a beautiful southern exposure.

definitions.definition: An instance of taking a photograph.
The piece of film exposed to light.
Details of the time and f-number used.
The amount of sun, wind etc. experienced by a particular site.
